bugs.title: gdcm fails to build with Python 3.13: error: ‘PyEval_CallObject’ was not declared in this scope; did you mean ‘PyObject_CallObject’?

bugzilla.short_desc: gdcm fails to build with Python 3.13: error: ‘PyEval_CallObject’ was not declared in this scope; did you mean ‘PyObject_CallObject’?

long_desc.thetext: This is a tracking bug for F41 Changes.
Created early as we deferred the DNF 5 Change from F39 to F41 and need to track that. Version will need resetting when F40 branches.
This is a tracking bug for F41 Changes.
Created early as we deferred the DNF 5 Change from F39 to F41 and need to track that. Version will need resetting when F40 branches.

This is a tracking bug for Change: Python built with gcc -O3
For more details, see: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Changes/Python_built_with_gcc_O3

Instead of Fedora's default -O2 compiler flag, we will use -O3 to build CPython.
This only impacts the interpreter and Python standard library, not any 3rd party extension modules built as RPM or on developer machines.
This aligns with the way Python is built upstream.
According to our performance measurements, it makes Python significantly faster (pyperformance geometric mean: 1.04x faster).

If you encounter a bug related to this Change, please do not comment here. Instead create a new bug and set it to block this bug.
This is now live in Python 3.13. Waiting for Python 3.13 to become the main Python before considering backports to other places.
Python 3.13 is the main Python now.
This is a tracking Bugzilla for Python 3.13-related work.

gdcm fails to build with Python 3.13.0a1.

/builddir/build/BUILD/GDCM-3.0.22/redhat-linux-build/Wrapping/Python/CMakeFiles/gdcmswig.dir/gdcmswigPYTHON_wrap.cxx:7116:12: error: ‘PyEval_CallObject’ was not declared in this scope; did you mean ‘PyObject_CallObject’?
 7116 |   result = PyEval_CallObject(func, arglist);
      |            ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      |            PyObject_CallObject

According to https://docs.python.org/3.13/whatsnew/3.13.html:
Remove PyEval_CallObject(), PyEval_CallObjectWithKeywords(): use PyObject_CallNoArgs() or PyObject_Call() instead.
Warning: PyObject_Call() positional arguments must be a tuple and must not be NULL,
keyword arguments must be a dict or NULL, whereas removed functions checked arguments type and accepted NULL positional and keyword arguments.
To replace PyEval_CallObjectWithKeywords(func, NULL, kwargs) with PyObject_Call(),
pass an empty tuple as positional arguments using PyTuple_New(0).

https://docs.python.org/3.13/whatsnew/3.13.html

For the build logs, see:
https://copr-be.cloud.fedoraproject.org/results/@python/python3.13/fedora-rawhide-x86_64/06546782-gdcm/

For all our attempts to build gdcm with Python 3.13, see:
https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/g/python/python3.13/package/gdcm/

Testing and mass rebuild of packages is happening in copr.
You can follow these instructions to test locally in mock if your package builds with Python 3.13:
https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/g/python/python3.13/

Let us know here if you have any questions.

Python 3.13 is planned to be included in Fedora 41.
To make that update smoother, we're building Fedora packages with all pre-releases of Python 3.13.
A build failure prevents us from testing all dependent packages (transitive [Build]Requires),
so if this package is required a lot, it's important for us to get it fixed soon.

We'd appreciate help from the people who know this package best,
but if you don't want to work on this now, let us know so we can try to work around it on our side.

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora Linux 40 development cycle.
Changing version to 40.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-22391 gdcm: crafted malformed file can lead to memory corruption due to heap overflow [fedora-40]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-22391 gdcm: crafted malformed file can lead to memory corruption due to heap overflow [fedora-40]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-22391 gdcm: crafted malformed file can lead to memory corruption due to heap overflow

long_desc.thetext:
A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the LookupTable::SetLUT functionality of Mathieu Malaterre Grassroot DICOM 3.0.23. A specially crafted malformed file can lead to memory corruption. An attacker can provide a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2024-1924

Created gdcm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-38 [bug 2277286]
Affects: fedora-39 [bug 2277287]
Affects: fedora-40 [bug 2277288]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2277284

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2277284,2277288

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
This affects all Fedora branches, including rawhide, for which, surprisingly, no separate bug was opened.
*** Bug 2277287 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 2277286 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Preparing update, applying upstream patches and testing.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-22373 gdcm: out-of-bounds write vulnerability lead to a heap buffer overflow [fedora-40]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-22373 gdcm: out-of-bounds write vulnerability lead to a heap buffer overflow [fedora-40]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-22373 gdcm: out-of-bounds write vulnerability lead to a heap buffer overflow

long_desc.thetext:
An out-of-bounds write vulnerability exists in the JPEG2000Codec::DecodeByStreamsCommon functionality of Mathieu Malaterre Grassroot DICOM 3.0.23. A specially crafted DICOM file can lead to a heap buffer overflow. An attacker can provide a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2024-1935

Created gdcm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-38 [bug 2277290]
Affects: fedora-39 [bug 2277291]
Affects: fedora-40 [bug 2277292]
What about EPEL 9? I believe the version of gdcm in EPEL 9 is also affected. I'm currently applying the patches to that branch as well.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2277289

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=high

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2277289,2277292

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
This affects all Fedora branches, including rawhide, for which, surprisingly, no separate bug was opened.
*** Bug 2277290 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 2277291 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Preparing update, applying upstream patches and testing.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-25569 gdcm: out-of-bounds read vulnerability in the RAWCodec::DecodeBytes [fedora-40]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-25569 gdcm: out-of-bounds read vulnerability in the RAWCodec::DecodeBytes [fedora-40]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-25569 gdcm: out-of-bounds read vulnerability in the RAWCodec::DecodeBytes

long_desc.thetext:
An out-of-bounds read vulnerability exists in the RAWCodec::DecodeBytes functionality of Mathieu Malaterre Grassroot DICOM 3.0.23. A specially crafted DICOM file can lead to an out-of-bounds read. An attacker can provide a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2024-1944

Created gdcm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-38 [bug 2277294]
Affects: fedora-39 [bug 2277295]
Affects: fedora-40 [bug 2277296]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2277293

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
